dt: {bc}a limitation on the use or enjoyment of property or a facility

et: Middle English {it}restriccioun{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}restriction{/it}, from Late Latin {it}restriction-, restrictio{/it}, from Latin {it}restringere{/it}
shortdef: a regulation that restricts or restrains
a limitation on the use or enjoyment of property or a facility

dt: {bc}any of various enzymes that cleave DNA into fragments at specific sites in the interior of the molecule

shortdef: any of various enzymes that cleave DNA into fragments at specific sites in the interior of the molecule —called also restriction endonuclease

dt: {bc}variation in the length of a DNA fragment produced by a specific restriction enzyme acting on DNA from different individuals that usually results from a gene mutation and that may be used as a genetic marker

shortdef: variation in the length of a DNA fragment produced by a specific restriction enzyme acting on DNA from different individuals that usually results from a gene mutation and that may be used as a genetic marker
